explanation: Martin claims he was at a cybersecurity seminar at the Grandview Conference Center all day Thursday. But Clue 3 reveals the seminar was held on Wednesday, not Thursday â€” the center had no events on Thursday at all. Martin lied about his whereabouts. Clue 1 shows the intern left his computer unlocked at 12:25 PM and returned at 12:40 PM. Clue 2 confirms the email was typed directly on the intern's workstation and took about five minutes. As IT administrator, Martin knew the intern's desk location and could quickly type the email during the fifteen-minute window while the intern was away.
funFact: Nearly 60% of employees admit to leaving their computers unlocked when stepping away, making 'shoulder surfing' and unauthorized computer access two of the most common workplace security violations.
